title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1850.10 - Attorney-fiduciaries-trustees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1850.10 - Attorney-fiduciaries-trustees

State Regulations

In all instances where an attorney is
appointed as trustee, he/she shall not be entitled to receiving or paying
commissions without prior court approval, except as provided in SCPA, sections
2308 and 2309, and he/she shall not be authorized to pay any legal fees, except
as provided in SCPA, section 2111. In the event legal fees are paid pursuant to
SCPA ยง 2111(2), the reasonableness of said legal fees are subject to
review by this court. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1850.10

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
